member.summary: Creates valid nonce value.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.CreateOpaque
member.summary: Creates valid opaque value.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.RequestMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets request method.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Realm
member.summary: Gets or sets a string to be displayed to users so they know which username and password to use. This string should contain at least the name of the host performing the authentication and might additionally indicate the collection of users who might have access. An example might be "registered_users@gotham.news.com".

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Nonce
member.summary: Gets or sets a server-specified unique data string. It is recommended that this string be base64 or hexadecimal data. Suggested value: base64(time-stamp hex(time-stamp ":" ETag ":" private-key)).
member.exception: Is raised when invalid value is specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Opaque
member.summary: Gets or sets string of data, specified by the server, which should be returned by the client unchanged. It is recommended that this string be base64 or hexadecimal data.
member.exception: Is raised when invalid value is specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Algorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets algorithm to use to produce the digest and a checksum. This is normally MD5 or MD5-sess.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Response
member.summary: Gets a string of 32 hex digits computed by HTTP digest algorithm, which proves that the user knows a password.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.UserName
member.summary: Gets or sets user name.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets password.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Uri
member.summary: Gets the URI from Request-URI.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Qop
member.summary: Gets or sets value what indicates "quality of protection" the client has applied to the message. If present, its value MUST be one of the alternatives the server indicated it supports in the WWW-Authenticate header. This directive is optional in order to preserve backward compatibility.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.CNonce
member.summary: Gets or sets Client nonce value. This MUST be specified if a qop directive is sent (see above), and MUST NOT be specified if the server did not send a qop directive in the WWW-Authenticate header field.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.NonceCount
member.summary: Gets or stets nonce count. This MUST be specified if a qop directive is sent (see above), and MUST NOT be specified if the server did not send a qop directive in the WWW-Authenticate header field. The nc-value is the hexadecimal count of the number of requests.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.AUTH_SASL_DigestMD5_Response.#ctor(LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.AUTH_SASL_DigestMD5_Challenge,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: Realm value. This must be one value of the challenge Realm.
Nonce count. One-based client authentication attempt number. Normally this value is 1.
Indicates what "quality of protection" the client accepted. This must be one value of the challenge QopOptions.
member.exception: Is raised when challenge,realm,password,nonce,qop or digestUri is null reference.

member.summary: Internal parse constructor.

member.summary: Parses DIGEST-MD5 response from response-string.
member.exception: Is raised when digestResponse isnull reference.
Is raised when response parsing + validation fails.

member.summary: Authenticates user.
member.returns: Returns true if user authenticated, otherwise false.
member.exception: Is raised when userName or password is null reference.

member.remarks: The character "*" is a wildcard, and matches zero or more characters at this position. The character "%" is similar to "*", but it does not match a hierarchy delimiter. If the "%" wildcard is the last character of a mailbox name argument, matching levels of hierarchy are also returned.

member.summary: No permissions at all.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_ACL_Flags.l
member.summary: Lookup (mailbox is visible to LIST/LSUB commands).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_ACL_Flags.r
member.summary: Read (SELECT the mailbox, perform CHECK, FETCH, PARTIAL,SEARCH, COPY from mailbox).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_ACL_Flags.s
member.summary: Keep seen/unseen information across sessions (STORE SEEN flag).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_ACL_Flags.w
member.summary: Write (STORE flags other than SEEN and DELETED).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_ACL_Flags.i
member.summary: Insert (perform APPEND, COPY into mailbox).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_ACL_Flags.p
member.summary: Post (send mail to submission address for mailbox,not enforced by IMAP4 itself).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_ACL_Flags.c
member.summary: Create (CREATE new sub-mailboxes in any implementation-defined hierarchy).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_ACL_Flags.d
member.summary: Delete (STORE DELETED flag, perform EXPUNGE).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_ACL_Flags.a
member.summary: Administer (perform SETACL).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_ACL_Flags.All
member.summary: All permissions

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_t_SeqSet
member.summary:
IMAP sequence-set. Defined in RFC 3501.
Examples: 2 -> seq-number (2) 2:4 -> seq-range (from 2 - 4) 2:* -> seq-range (from 2 to last) 2,3,10:* -> sequence-set (seq-number,seq-number,seq-range) (2,3, 10 - last)
NOTES: *) comma separates sequence parts *) * means maximum value.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_SequenceSet
member.summary:
IMAP sequence-set. RFC 3501.
Examples: 2 -> seq-number (2) 2:4 -> seq-range (from 2 - 4) 2:* -> seq-range (from 2 to last) 2,3,10:* -> sequence-set (seq-number,seq-number,seq-range) (2,3, 10 - last)
NOTES: *) comma separates sequence parts *) * means maximum value.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.summary: Parses sequence-set from specified string. Throws exception if invalid sequnce-set value.
member.param: Maximum value. This if for replacement of * value.

member.summary: Gets if sequence set contains specified number.

member.summary: Converts IMAP_SequenceSet to IMAP sequence-set string.

member.summary: Parses seq-number from specified value. Throws exception if invalid seq-number value.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mail.Mail_h_Received
member.summary: Represents "Received:" header. Defined in RFC 5321 4.4.

remarks.code:
RFC 5321 4.4. Time-stamp-line = "Received:" FWS Stamp CRLF
Stamp = From-domain By-domain Opt-info [CFWS] ";" FWS date-time ; where "date-time" is as defined in RFC 5322 [4] ; but the "obs-" forms, especially two-digit ; years, are prohibited in SMTP and MUST NOT be used.
From-domain = "FROM" FWS Extended-Domain
By-domain = CFWS "BY" FWS Extended-Domain
Extended-Domain = Domain / ( Domain FWS "(" TCP-info ")" ) / ( address-literal FWS "(" TCP-info ")" )
TCP-info = address-literal / ( Domain FWS address-literal ) ; Information derived by server from TCP connection not client EHLO.
Opt-info = [Via] [With] [ID] [For] [Additional-Registered-Clauses]
Via = CFWS "VIA" FWS Link
With = CFWS "WITH" FWS Protocol
ID = CFWS "ID" FWS ( Atom / msg-id ) ; msg-id is defined in RFC 5322 [4]
For = CFWS "FOR" FWS ( Path / Mailbox )
Additional-Registered-Clauses = CFWS Atom FWS String
Link = "TCP" / Addtl-Link
Addtl-Link = Atom
Protocol = "ESMTP" / "SMTP" / Attdl-Protocol
Mailbox = Local-part "@" ( Domain / address-literal )

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_b_MessageDeliveryStatus
member.summary: This class represents MIME message/delivery-status body. Defined in RFC 3464.

remarks.code:
delivery-status-content = per-message-fields 1*( CRLF per-recipient-fields )
per-message-fields = [ original-envelope-id-field CRLF ] reporting-mta-field CRLF [ dsn-gateway-field CRLF ] [ received-from-mta-field CRLF ] [ arrival-date-field CRLF ] *( extension-field CRLF )
per-recipient-fields = [ original-recipient-field CRLF ] final-recipient-field CRLF action-field CRLF status-field CRLF [ remote-mta-field CRLF ] [ diagnostic-code-field CRLF ] [ last-attempt-date-field CRLF ] [ final-log-id-field CRLF ] [ will-retry-until-field CRLF ] *( extension-field CRLF )

member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: Is raised when buffer is null reference.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_b_Multipart._MultipartReader.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: Is raised when this method is accessed.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition
member.summary: Represents "Content-Disposition:" header. Defined in RFC 2183.

example.code:
RFC 2183. In the extended BNF notation of [RFC 822], the Content-Disposition header field is defined as follows:
disposition := "Content-Disposition" ":" disposition-type *(";" disposition-parm)
disposition-type := "inline" / "attachment" / extension-token ; values are not case-sensitive
disposition-parm := filename-parm / creation-date-parm / modification-date-parm / read-date-parm / size-parm / parameter
filename-parm := "filename" "=" value
creation-date-parm := "creation-date" "=" quoted-date-time
modification-date-parm := "modification-date" "=" quoted-date-time
read-date-parm := "read-date" "=" quoted-date-time
size-parm := "size" "=" 1*DIGIT
quoted-date-time := quoted-string ; contents MUST be an RFC 822 `date-time' ; numeric timezones (+HHMM or -HHMM) MUST be used

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: The disposition-type. Known values are in MIME_DispositionTypes.
member.exception: Is raised when dispositionType is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.

member.summary: Internal parser constructor.

member.summary: Parses header field from the specified value.
member.param: Header field value. Header field name must be included. For example: 'Content-Type: text/plain'.
member.exception: Is raised when value is null reference.
Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.summary: Returns header field as string.
member.param: 8-bit words ecnoder. Value null means that words are not encoded.
Charset to use to encode 8-bit characters. Value null means parameters not encoded.
If true always specified encoding is used. If false and header field value not modified, original encoding is kept.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentType
member.summary: Represents "Content-Type:" header. Defined in RFC 2045 5.1.

remarks.code:
RFC 2045 5.1. In the Augmented BNF notation of RFC 822, a Content-Type header field value is defined as follows:
content := "Content-Type" ":" type "/" subtype *(";" parameter) ; Matching of media type and subtype ; is ALWAYS case-insensitive.
type := discrete-type / composite-type
discrete-type := "text" / "image" / "audio" / "video" / "application" / extension-token
composite-type := "message" / "multipart" / extension-token
extension-token := ietf-token / x-token
ietf-token := (An extension token defined by a standards-track RFC and registered with IANA.)
x-token := (The two characters "X-" or "x-" followed, with no intervening white space, by any token)
subtype := extension-token / iana-token
iana-token := (A publicly-defined extension token. Tokens of this form must be registered with IANA as specified in RFC 2048.)
parameter := attribute "=" value
attribute := token ; Matching of attributes ; is ALWAYS case-insensitive.
value := token / quoted-string
token := 1*(any (US-ASCII) CHAR except SPACE, CTLs,or tspecials)
tspecials := "(" / ")" / "<" / ">" / "@" / "," / ";" / ":" / "\" / " "/" / "[" / "]" / "?" / "=" ; Must be in quoted-string, ; to use within parameter values

member.param: Media type with subtype. For example text/plain.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_DispositionTypes
member.summary: This class holds MIME content disposition types. Defined in RFC 2183.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_DispositionTypes.Inline
member.summary: A bodypart should be marked `inline' if it is intended to be displayed automatically upon display of the message. Inline bodyparts should be presented in the order in which they occur, subject to the normal semantics of multipart messages.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_DispositionTypes.Attachment
member.summary: Bodyparts can be designated `attachment' to indicate that they are separate from the main body of the mail message, and that their display should not be automatic, but contingent upon some further action of the user.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_MediaTypes
member.summary: This class holds well known Content-Type header field media types. For example: text/plain, application/octet-stream. Full IANA registered list can be found from: http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_MediaTypes.Application

Header 8-bit words ecnoder. Value null means that words are not encoded.

Header 8-bit words ecnoder. Value null means that words are not encoded.
Charset to use to encode 8-bit header parameters. Value null means parameters not encoded.
If true always specified encoding is used for header. If false and header field value not modified, original encoding is kept.
member.exception: Is raised when file is null.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.

member.summary: Gets if this object is disposed.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.IsModified
member.summary: Gets if this entity is modified since it has loaded.
member.exception: Is riased when this class is disposed and this property is accessed.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.Parent
member.summary: Gets the parent entity of this entity, returns null if this is the root entity.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.Header
member.summary: Gets MIME entity header field collection.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.MimeVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets MIME version number. Value null means that header field does not exist. Normally this value is 1.0. Defined in RFC 2045 section 4.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: An indicator that this message is formatted according to the MIME standard, and an indication of which version of MIME is used.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentID
member.summary: Gets or sets content body part ID. Value null means that header field does not exist. Defined in RFC 2045 7.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Specifies a Unique ID for one MIME body part of the content of a message.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets description of message body part. Value null means that header field does not exist. Defined in RFC 2045 8.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Description of a particular body part of a message; for example, a caption for an image body part.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets content transfer encoding. Value null means that header field does not exist. RFC defined values are in MIME_TransferEncodings. Defined in RFC 2045 6.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Coding method used in a MIME message body part.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets MIME content type. Value null means that header field does not exist. Defined in RFC 2045 5.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentBase
member.summary: Gets or sets base to be used for resolving relative URIs within this content part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Base to be used for resolving relative URIs within this content part. See also Content-Location.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets URI for retrieving a body part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: URI using which the content of this body-part part was retrieved, might be retrievable, or which otherwise gives a globally unique identification of the content.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.Contentfeatures
member.summary: Gets or sets content features of a MIME body part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: The 'Content-features:' header can be used to annotate a MIME body part with a media feature expression, to indicate features of the body part content. See also RFC 2533, RFC 2506, and RFC 2045.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets or sets content disposition. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Indicates whether a MIME body part is to be shown inline or is an attachment; can also indicate a suggested filename for use when saving an attachment to a file.
member.exception: Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets language of message content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Can include a code for the natural language used in a message; e.g., 'en' for English. Can also contain a list of languages for a message containing more than one language.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentAlternative
member.summary: Gets or sets message alternative content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Information about the media features of alternative content formats available for the current message.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentMD5
member.summary: Gets or sets content MD5 checksum. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Checksum of content to ensure that it has not been modified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets time duration of content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Time duration of body part content, in seconds (e.g., for audio message).

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets MIME entity body.
member.exception: Is raised when null reference passed.

member.summary: MIME lexical tokens parser.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.summary: Reads RFC 2822 'dot-atom' from source stream.

member.summary: Reads RFC 2045 (section 5) 'token' from source stream.
member.returns: Returns RFC 2045 (section 5) 'token' or null if end of stream reached.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.Comment
member.summary: Reads RFC 822 'comment' from source stream.
member.returns: Returns RFC 822 'comment' or null if end of stream reached.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.Word
member.summary: Reads RFC 2822 (section 3.2.6) 'word' from source stream.
member.returns: Returns RFC 2822 (section 3.2.6) 'word' or null if end of stream reached.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.EncodedWord
member.summary: Reads RFC 2047 'encoded-word' from source stream.
member.returns: Returns RFC 2047 'encoded-word' or null if end of stream reached.
member.exception: Is raised when source stream has no encoded-word at current position.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.QuotedString
member.summary: Reads RFC 822 'quoted-string' from source stream.
member.returns: Returns RFC 822 'quoted-string' or null if end of stream reached.
member.exception: Is raised when source stream has no quoted-string at current position.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.Value
member.summary: Reads RFC 2045 (section 5) 'token' from source stream.
member.returns: Returns 2045 (section 5) 'token' or null if end of stream reached.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.Phrase
member.summary: Reads RFC 2047 (section 5) 'phrase' from source stream.
member.returns: Returns RFC 2047 (section 5) 'phrase' or null if end of stream reached.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.Text
member.summary: Reads RFC 822 '*text' from source stream.
member.returns: Returns RFC 822 '*text' or null if end of stream reached.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.ToFirstChar
member.summary: Reads all white-space chars + CR and LF.

member.summary: Reads 1 char from source stream.

member.summary: Shows next char in source stream, this method won't consume that char.
member.param: Specifies if postion is moved to char(skips white spaces).
member.returns: Returns next char in source stream, returns -1 if end of stream.

member.summary: Gets if source stream valu starts with the specified value. Compare is case-insensitive.
member.returns: Returns true if source steam satrs with specified string.
member.exception: Is raised when value is null.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.ToEnd
member.summary: Reads all data from current postion to the end.
member.returns: Retruns readed data. Returns null if end of string is reached.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.IsAlpha(System.Char)
member.summary: Gets if the specified char is RFC 822 'ALPHA'.
member.returns: Returns true if specified char is RFC 822 'ALPHA'.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.IsAText(System.Char)
member.summary: Gets if the specified char is RFC 2822 'atext'.
member.returns: Returns true if specified char is RFC 2822 'atext'.

member.summary: Gets if the specified value can be represented as "dot-atom".
member.returns: Returns true if the specified value can be represented as "dot-atom".

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.IsToken(System.String)
member.summary: Gets if specified valu is RFC 2045 (section 5) 'token'.
member.returns: Returns true if specified char is RFC 2045 (section 5) 'token'.
member.exception: Is raised when text is null.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.IsToken(System.Char)
member.summary: Gets if the specified char is RFC 2045 (section 5) 'token'.
member.returns: Returns true if specified char is RFC 2045 (section 5) 'token'.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.IsAttributeChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Gets if the specified char is RFC 2231 (section 7) 'attribute-char'.
member.returns: Returns true if specified char is RFC 2231 (section 7) 'attribute-char'.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.ReadParenthesized
member.summary: Reads parenthesized value. Supports {},(),[],<> parenthesis. Throws exception if there isn't parenthesized value or closing parenthesize is missing.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.QuotedReadToDelimiter(System.Char[])
member.summary: Reads string to specified delimiter or to end of underlying string. Notes: Delimiters in quoted string is skipped. For example: delimiter = ',', text = '"aaaa,eee",qqqq' - then result is '"aaaa,eee"'.
member.returns: Returns readed string or null if end of string reached.
member.exception: Is raised when delimiters is null reference.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.Available
member.summary: Gets number of chars has left for processing.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Reader.Position
member.summary: Gets position in string.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings
member.summary: This class holds MIME content transfer encodings. Defined in RFC 2045 6.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.SevenBit
member.summary: Up to 998 octets per line of the code range 1..127 with CR and LF (codes 13 and 10 respectively) only allowed to appear as part of a CRLF line ending. This is the default value. Defined in RFC 2045 6.2.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.EightBit
member.summary: Up to 998 octets per line with CR and LF (codes 13 and 10 respectively) only allowed to appear as part of a CRLF line ending. Defined in RFC 2045 6.2.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Used to encode arbitrary octet sequences into a form that satisfies the rules of 7bit. Designed to be efficient and mostly human readable when used for text data consisting primarily of US-ASCII characters but also containing a small proportion of bytes with values outside that range. Defined in RFC 2045 6.7.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.Base64
member.summary: Used to encode arbitrary octet sequences into a form that satisfies the rules of 7bit. Has a fixed overhead and is intended for non text data and text that is not ASCII heavy. Defined in RFC 2045 6.8.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.Binary
member.summary: Any sequence of octets. This type is not widely used. Defined in RFC 3030.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Utils.CreateMessageID
member.summary: Creates Rfc 2822 3.6.4 message-id. Syntax: '<' id-left '@' id-right '>'.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Utils.ParseHeaders(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Parses headers from message or mime entry.
member.param: Stream from where to read headers.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Utils.ParseHeaderField(System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary:
Parse header specified header field value.
Use this method only if you need to get only one header field, otherwise use MimeParser.ParseHeaderField(string fieldName,string headers). This avoid parsing headers multiple times.
member.param: Header field which to parse. Eg. Subject: .
Stream from where to read headers.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Utils.ParseHeaderField(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Parse header specified header field value.
member.param: Header field which to parse. Eg. Subject: .
Full headers string. Use MimeParser.ParseHeaders() to get this value.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Utils.QDecode(System.Text.Encoding,System.String)
member.summary: "Q" decoder. This is same as quoted-printable, except '_' is converted to ' '. Defined in RFC 2047 4.2.
member.exception: Is raised when encoding or data is null reference.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Utils.QuotedPrintableDecode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: quoted-printable decoder. Defined in RFC 2045 6.7.
member.exception: Is raised when data is null reference.
